intro: Cleistanthus pseudomyrianthus, commonly known as the African star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a fragrant scent. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine. Cleistanthus pseudomyrianthus thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, humid climate for optimal growth.
